00058 /**
00059  * Read in a file of probe IDs
00060  */
00061 void EngineUtil::readProbeFile( std::vector< std::vector< probeid_t > > &probeIds, 
00062                                 const std::string& probeFileName) {
00063 
00064     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00065     probeid_t probeId;
00066     int channelIx = 0;
00067     /* sanity checks */
00068     if (tsv.open(probeFileName) != TSV_OK) {
00069         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + string(probeFileName) + " to read.");
00070     }
00071 
00072     if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probe_id") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00073         tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00074     }
00075     else {
00076         Err::errAbort("Unable to find probe_id column in file '"+ToStr(probeFileName)+"'");
00077     }
00078 
00079     if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "channel") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00080         tsv.bind(0, "channel", &channelIx, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00081     }
00082 //     else
00083 //         Err::errAbort("Unable to find channel column in file '"+ToStr(probeFileName)+"'");
00084 
00085     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00086         if (channelIx >= probeIds.size()) {
00087             probeIds.resize(channelIx + 1);
00088         }
00089         probeIds[channelIx].push_back(TO_ZEROBASED(probeId));
00090     }
00091     tsv.close();
00092 }
00093 
00094 void EngineUtil::readProbeFile(std::vector<probeid_t> &probeIds, 
00095                                const std::string& probeFileName) {
00096 
00097     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00098     probeid_t probeId;
00099     /* sanity checks */
00100     if (tsv.open(probeFileName) != TSV_OK) 
00101         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + string(probeFileName) + " to read.");
00102     if (tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probe_id") != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND)
00103         tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00104     else
00105         Err::errAbort("Unable to find probe_id column in file '"+ToStr(probeFileName)+"'");
00106 
00107     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00108         probeIds.push_back(TO_ZEROBASED(probeId));
00109     }
00110     tsv.close();
00111 }
00112 
00113 void EngineUtil::readProbeFiles(std::vector<probeid_t> &probeIds,
00114                                 const vector<std::string>& probeFileNames) {
00115     for (int i=0;i<probeFileNames.size();i++) {
00116         readProbeFile(probeIds,probeFileNames[i]);
00117     }
00118 }

00121 /**
00122  * Read in a file of probeset names or IDs. IDs trumps names.
00123  */
00124 void EngineUtil::readProbeSetFile(std::vector<std::string> &probeSets, 
00125                                   const std::string& probeSetFileName) {
00126     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00127     string probeset;
00128 
00129     //
00130     if (tsv.open(probeSetFileName) != TSV_OK) 
00131         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + probeSetFileName + " to read.");
00132 
00133     //
00134     int cidx;
00135     // we try all of these in a case insenstive manner as other people like to use spaces.
00136     // we (APT) dont like spaces in column names as that causes problems
00137     // (Some programs treat spaces as tabs.)
00138     if ((cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_id",affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE)) != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00139       tsv.bind(0, cidx, &probeset,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00140     }
00141     else if ((cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset id",affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE)) != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00142       tsv.bind(0, cidx, &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00143     }
00144     else if ((cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probe set id",affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE)) != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00145       tsv.bind(0, cidx, &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00146     }
00147     else if ((cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0, "probeset_name",affx::TSV_OPT_CASEINSENSTIVE)) != TSV_ERR_NOTFOUND) {
00148       tsv.bind(0, cidx, &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00149     }
00150     else
00151         Err::errAbort("Unable to find probeset_id or probeset_name column in file '"+probeSetFileName+"'");
00152 
00153     // slurp the list.
00154     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK)
00155         probeSets.push_back(probeset);
00156     
00157     tsv.close();
00158 }
00159 
00160 void EngineUtil::readProbeSetFiles(std::vector<std::string> &probeSets, 
00161                                    const std::vector<std::string>& probeSetFileNames) {
00162     for (int i=0;i<probeSetFileNames.size();i++) {
00163         readProbeSetFile(probeSets,probeSetFileNames[i]);
00164     }
00165 }

00167 /**
00168  * Read in the probe class file
00169  *
00170  * @param file   - The file to read
00171  * @param masks  - Vector of probe masks to fill in
00172  */
00173 void EngineUtil::readProbeClassFile(const string &file, const int arraySize, 
00174                                     map<string, vector<bool> > &classMap) {
00175     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00176     int probeId = 0;
00177     string probeClass;
00178     map<string, vector<bool> >::iterator classMapIter;
00179 
00180 
00181     tsv.bind(0, "probe_id", &probeId, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00182     tsv.bind(0, "class", &probeClass, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00183     if (tsv.open(file) != TSV_OK)
00184         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: '" + file + "' to read.");
00185 
00186 
00187     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00188         classMapIter = classMap.find(probeClass);
00189         if (classMapIter == classMap.end()) {
00190             classMap[probeClass].resize(arraySize,false);
00191         }
00192         classMap[probeClass].at(probeId-1) = true;
00193     }
00194     tsv.close();
00195 }

00198 /**
00199  * Return true if the qType of chip is found in the list of possible
00200  * types that are ok. Note that this is a case sensitive operation and
00201  * is meant to be so.
00202  * We want to be restrictive to avoid problems later on.
00203  * Filesystems we care about are at least case-preserving (HFS+)
00204  */
00205 bool EngineUtil::checkChipTypeOk(const std::string &qType, const std::vector<std::string> &possibleTypes) {
00206     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < possibleTypes.size(); i++) {
00207         if (qType == possibleTypes[i]) {
00208             return true;
00209         }
00210     }
00211     // maybe they have the wrong case?
00212     // we always return false, but we can say what is wrong.
00213     std::string qType_lower=Util::downcaseString(qType);
00214     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < possibleTypes.size(); i++) {
00215         std::string possibleType_lower=Util::downcaseString(possibleTypes[i]);
00216         if (qType_lower == possibleType_lower) {
00217             Verbose::out(1,"Case mismatch in chiptypes. ('"+qType+"'!='"+possibleTypes[i]+"') Case must match.");
00218             return false;
00219         }
00220     }
00221 
00222     return false;
00223 }
00224 
00225 /**
00226  * Check chip types in TSV file against those in chipTypes vector
00227  */
00228 void EngineUtil::checkTsvFileChipType(const string &path, 
00229                                       const std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes,
00230                                       bool mustSee) {
00231     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00232     string chip;
00233     vector<string> chipSeen;
00234     if (tsv.open(path) != TSV_OK)
00235         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: '" + path + "' to read.");
00236     bool chipMatch = false;
00237     if (chipTypes[0] == "")
00238         chipMatch = true; // treat empty as wildcard.
00239     while (tsv.headersFindNext("chip-type", chip) == TSV_OK) {
00240         chipSeen.push_back(chip);
00241         for (int i = 0; i<chipTypes.size(); i++) {
00242             if (chip == chipTypes[i])
00243                 chipMatch = true;
00244         }
00245     }
00246     if (!chipMatch && (chipSeen.size() > 0 || mustSee)) {
00247         string foundTypes, expectedTypes;
00248         for (int i=0; i<chipSeen.size(); i++)
00249             foundTypes += chipSeen[i] + ", ";
00250         for (int i=0; i<chipTypes.size(); i++)
00251             expectedTypes += chipTypes[i] + ", ";
00252 
00253         Err::errAbort("Chiptype(s) [" + foundTypes + "] in file '" + path + "' does not match the set of valid chip types [" + expectedTypes + "]");
00254     }
00255 }
00256 
00257 /**
00258  * Check to make sure that there is at least one match between the two
00259  * vectors of chip types. Call Err::errAbort() if not.
00260  */
00261 void EngineUtil::checkChipTypeVectors(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypesOk,
00262                                       std::vector<std::string> &chipTypesCheck) {
00263     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < chipTypesCheck.size(); i++)
00264         if (checkChipTypeOk(chipTypesCheck[i],chipTypesOk))
00265             return;
00266     std::string chipTypeString = "";
00267     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < chipTypesOk.size(); i++)
00268         chipTypeString += chipTypesOk[i] + ", ";
00269     Verbose::out(1,"Expected Chip Types: " + chipTypeString);
00270     chipTypeString = "";
00271     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < chipTypesCheck.size(); i++)
00272         chipTypeString += chipTypesCheck[i] + ", ";
00273     Verbose::out(1,"Found Chip Types: " + chipTypeString);
00274     Err::errAbort("No matching chip types found.");
00275 }
00276 
00277 /** 
00278  * Check to make sure all the cel files are compatible with the
00279  * chiptypes supported and number or probes on them. Treats the empty
00280  * string "" as a wildcard, so if chipTypes contains "" then any chip
00281  * type is accepted, but only if number of probes is correct. Calls
00282  * Err::errAbort() if something is wrong.
00283  * 
00284  * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that are compatible.
00285  * @param probeCount - How many probes (aka features, ada cels) should be on array.
00286  * @param celFiles - Vector of cel file names to check.
00287  */
00288 void EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes, uint32_t probeCount,
00289                                    std::vector<std::string> &celFiles, uint32_t rows, uint32_t cols) {
00290     map<string,string> seenFiles;
00291     string root;
00292     FusionCELData cel;
00293   
00294     vector<string>::iterator celIx;
00295     bool allOk = true;
00296     int maxWarnings = 0;
00297     int vLevel = 1;
00298     for (celIx = celFiles.begin(); celIx != celFiles.end(); celIx++) {
00299         root = Fs::basename(*celIx);
00300         /* check to see we haven't seen this file before. */
00301         if (seenFiles.find(root) != seenFiles.end()) {
00302             Err::errAbort("Filename: '" + root + "' seen multiple times. Filenames must be unique.");
00303         }
00304         else {
00305             seenFiles[root] = "seen";
00306         }
00307   
00308         try {
00309           std::string tmp_unc_name=Fs::convertToUncPath(*celIx);
00310           cel.SetFileName(tmp_unc_name.c_str());
00311             if (!cel.ReadHeader())
00312               Err::errAbort("Can't read file: "+FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_name));
00313 
00314             bool hack = false;
00315             std::vector<std::wstring> data_channels = cel.GetChannels();
00316             if (data_channels.empty()) {
00317                 std::wstring temp = L"Default Group";
00318                 data_channels.push_back(temp);
00319             }
00320             else if (data_channels.size() > 1) {
00321                 affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericData *gd = cel.GetGenericData();
00322                 if (gd != NULL) {
00323                     if (gd->DataGroupCnt() != data_channels.size()) {
00324                         // Falcon Cel files with QC info have 3 data groups and two channels
00325                         // Internal single channel cel files from MC system at one point reported two channels, but only had one data group
00326                         if (gd->DataGroupCnt() == 1) {
00327                             Verbose::out(1,"WARNING: Bogus multi channel cel file hack triggered for cel file '"+*celIx+"'.");
00328                             hack = true;
00329                             std::wstring temp = L"Default Group";
00330                             data_channels.clear();
00331                             data_channels.push_back(temp);
00332                         }
00333                     }
00334                 }
00335             }
00336             for (int chanIx = 0; chanIx < data_channels.size(); chanIx++) {
00337                 if (!hack) {
00338                     cel.SetActiveDataGroup(data_channels[chanIx]);
00339                 }
00340 
00341                 if (cel.GetNumCells() != probeCount) {
00342                     Verbose::out(vLevel, "Wrong number of cells in channel " + ToStr(chanIx) + ": Expecting: " + ToStr(probeCount) + " and " +
00343                                  *celIx + " has: " + ToStr(cel.GetNumCells()));
00344                     allOk = false;
00345                 }
00346                 else if (cel.GetCols() != cols || cel.GetRows() != rows) {
00347                     Verbose::out(vLevel, "Row/Col mismatch in channel " + ToStr(chanIx) + ". Expecting " + ToStr(rows) + " rows and " + 
00348                                  ToStr(cols) + " cols. " + *celIx + " has " + ToStr(cel.GetRows()) +
00349                                  " rows and " + ToStr(cel.GetCols()) + " cols.");
00350                     allOk = false;
00351                 }
00352             }
00353             if (!checkChipTypeOk("", chipTypes) && 
00354                 !checkChipTypeOk(StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetChipType()), chipTypes)) {
00355                 Verbose::out(vLevel, "Wrong CEL ChipType: expecting: '" + chipTypes[0]  + "' and " +
00356                              *celIx + " is: '" + StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(cel.GetChipType()) + "'");
00357                 allOk = false;
00358             }
00359     
00360             if (allOk == false) { 
00361                 maxWarnings++; 
00362             }
00363             if (maxWarnings > 10) {
00364                 vLevel = 2;
00365             }
00366             cel.Close();
00367         }
00368         catch (...)
00369         {
00370             Err::errAbort("Can't read file: " + ToStr(*celIx));
00371         }
00372     }
00373     if (!allOk) {
00374         Err::errAbort("Different chiptypes or probe counts found. Only first 10 errors printed, see log for rest.");
00375     }
00376 }
00377 
00378 /** 
00379  * @brief Get a list from a text file to select a subset of probe sets for
00380  * analysis.
00381  * 
00382  * @param fileName - Path to file for reading probe subset from.
00383  * @param psGroups - Groups to be filled in, must be deleted later
00384  * @param psNameLoadMap - Map of probesets names to be loaded which is
00385  * filled in.
00386  */
00387 void EngineUtil::makePSetNameSubset(const std::string &fileName, 
00388                                     std::vector<ProbeSetGroup *> &psGroups, 
00389                                     std::map<std::string, bool> &psNameLoadMap) {
00390     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00391     std::string probeset;
00392     tsv.bind(0, "probeset_id", &probeset, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00393     if (tsv.open(fileName.c_str()) != TSV_OK) 
00394         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + fileName + " to read.");
00395 
00396     while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00397         psNameLoadMap[probeset] = true;
00398         ProbeSetGroup *ps = new ProbeSetGroup();
00399         ps->probeSetNames.push_back(Util::cloneString(probeset.c_str()));
00400         psGroups.push_back(ps);
00401     }
00402     tsv.close();
00403 }
00404 
00405 /** 
00406  * Open up a pgf and clf file pair and read the valid chiptypes
00407  * (i.e. HuEx-1_0-st-v2, HuEx-1_0-st-v1, HuEx-1_0-st-ta1) and number
00408  * of probes expected from them.
00409  * 
00410  * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
00411  * @param probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to clf file.
00412  * @param pgfFile - Name of pgf file to be opened and read from.
00413  * @param clfFile - Name of clf file to be opened and read from.
00414  */
00415 void EngineUtil::getPgfChipType(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes, 
00416                                 colrow_t& rowCount,
00417                                 colrow_t& colCount,
00418                                 int& probeCount,
00419                                 const std::string &pgfFile, 
00420                                 const std::string &clfFile) {
00421     PgfFile pgf;
00422     ClfFile clf;
00423     /* Fill in the chiptypes from the pgf file. */
00424     if (pgf.open(pgfFile) != TSV_OK) {
00425         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getChipType() - Can't open Pgf file: '" + pgfFile + "' to read.");
00426     }
00427     chipTypes.clear();
00428     string chip;
00429     while (pgf.m_tsv.headersFindNext("chip_type", chip) == TSV_OK) {
00430         chipTypes.push_back(chip);
00431     }
00432     pgf.close();
00433 
00434     /* Fill in the probecount from the clf file. */
00435     if (clf.open(clfFile) != TSV_OK) {
00436         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getChipType() - Can't open clf file: '" + clfFile + "' to read.");
00437     }
00438     int rows = 0, cols = 0;
00439     if (clf.m_tsv.getHeader("rows", rows) != TSV_OK) 
00440         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getPgfChipType() - Clf file format not valid, no 'rows' field.");
00441     if (clf.m_tsv.getHeader("cols", cols) != TSV_OK) 
00442         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getPgfChipType() - Clf file format not valid, no 'cols' field.");
00443     rowCount = rows;
00444     colCount = cols;
00445     probeCount = (uint32_t)rows * cols;
00446     clf.close();
00447 }
00448 
00449 /** 
00450  * Open up a spf (simple probe format) file and read the valid chiptypes 
00451  * (i.e. HuEx-1_0-st-v2, HuEx-1_0-st-v1, HuEx-1_0-st-ta1) and number
00452  * of probes expected.
00453  * 
00454  * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
00455  * @param probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to spf file.
00456  * @param spfFile - Name of spf file to be opened and read from.
00457  */
00458 void EngineUtil::getSpfChipType(std::vector<std::string>& chipTypes, 
00459                                 colrow_t& rowCount, 
00460                                 colrow_t& colCount,
00461                                 int& probeCount,
00462                                 int& probeSetCount,
00463                                 const std::string& spfFile) {
00464     TsvFile tsv;
00465     /* Fill in the chiptypes from the pgf file. */
00466     if (tsv.open(spfFile) != TSV_OK) {
00467         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getSpfChipType() - Can't open file: '" + spfFile + "' to read.");
00468     }
00469     chipTypes.clear();
00470     string chip;
00471     while (tsv.headersFindNext("chip_type", chip) == TSV_OK) {
00472         chipTypes.push_back(chip);
00473     }
00474     int rows = 0, cols = 0, probesets = 0;
00475     if (tsv.getHeader("num-rows", rows) != TSV_OK) 
00476         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getSpfChipType() - Spf file format not valid, no 'num-rows' field.");
00477     rowCount = rows;
00478     if (tsv.getHeader("num-cols", cols) != TSV_OK) 
00479         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getSpfChipType() - Spf file format not valid, no 'num-cols' field.");
00480     colCount = cols;
00481     probeCount = (uint32_t)rows * cols;
00482     if (tsv.getHeader("num-probesets", probesets) != TSV_OK) 
00483         Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getSpfChipType() - Spf file format not valid, no 'num-probesets' field.");
00484     probeSetCount = probesets;
00485 
00486     tsv.close();
00487 
00488   
00489 }
00490   
00491 /** 
00492  * Open up a cdf file and get the chip type (i.e. 'Mapping250K_Sty') and number
00493  * of probes on the chip.
00494  * 
00495  * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
00496  * @param rowCount - Number of rows on the chip.
00497  * @param colCount - Number of columns on chip.
00498  * @param probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to clf file.
00499  * @param cdfFile - Name of cdf file to be opened and read from.
00500  */
00501 void EngineUtil::getCdfChipType(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes, 
00502                                 colrow_t& rowCount, 
00503                                 colrow_t& colCount,
00504                                 int& probeCount,
00505                                 int& probeSetCount,
00506                                 const std::string &cdfFile) {
00507     FusionCDFData cdf;
00508     std::string tmp_unc_name=Fs::convertToUncPath(cdfFile);
00509     cdf.SetFileName(tmp_unc_name.c_str());
00510     try {
00511         if (!cdf.ReadHeader()) {
00512             Err::errAbort("EngineUtil::getCdfChipType() - Can't read header for " +
00513                           FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_name) +
00514                           ". Description: " + cdf.GetError());
00515         }
00516     }
00517     catch(...) {
00518       Err::errAbort("Can't read file: " + FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_name));
00519     }
00520     chipTypes.clear();
00521     chipTypes = cdf.GetChipTypes();
00522     FusionCDFFileHeader &cdfHeader = cdf.GetHeader();
00523     rowCount = cdfHeader.GetRows();
00524     colCount = cdfHeader.GetCols();
00525     probeCount = (uint32_t)rowCount * colCount;
00526     probeSetCount = cdfHeader.GetNumProbeSets();
00527 }
00528 
00529 /**
00530  * @brief Print out a header and then a series of self documenting
00531  * objects.
00532  * @param header - Descriptive header for this collection of self documenting objects.
00533  * @param doc - Collection of self documenting objects.
00534  */
00535 void EngineUtil::printSelfDocs(const char *header, vector<SelfDoc> doc) {
00536     unsigned int i = 0;
00537 
00538     int maxLength = 0;
00539     int extraChars = 3;
00540     cout << endl << header << endl;
00541     for (i=0; i < doc.size(); i++) {
00542         string s = doc[i].getDocName();
00543         maxLength = max((int)maxLength, (int)s.length());
00544     }
00545     maxLength += 3 + extraChars;
00546     maxLength = min(maxLength, 25);
00547     for (i=0; i < doc.size(); i++) {
00548         int currentLength = 0;
00549         string s = doc[i].getDocName();
00550         cout << "   " << s;
00551         currentLength = s.length() + 3;
00552         while (currentLength < maxLength) {
00553             cout.put(' ');
00554             currentLength++;
00555         }
00556         PgOptions::printStringWidth(doc[i].getDocDescription().c_str(), maxLength, currentLength);
00557         cout << endl;
00558     }
00559 }
00560 
00561 /**
00562  * Print out a little ditty for the given type of self documenting object.
00563  *
00564  * @param query - type of analysis/adjustment/summarization information is desired for.
00565  */
00566 void EngineUtil::explainParameter(const std::string& query) {
00567     ChipStreamFactory cFactory;
00568     PmAdjusterFactory aFactory;
00569     QuantMethodFactory qFactory(QuantMethodFactory::Expression);
00570     QuantMethodFactory gFactory(QuantMethodFactory::GenoType);
00571     AnalysisStreamFactory asFactory;
00572     vector<vector<SelfDoc> > docs;
00573 
00574   
00575     docs.push_back(cFactory.getDocs());
00576     docs.push_back(aFactory.getDocs());
00577     docs.push_back(qFactory.getDocs());
00578     docs.push_back(gFactory.getDocs());
00579     docs.push_back(asFactory.getDocs());
00580 
00581     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < docs.size(); i++) {
00582         for (unsigned int j = 0; j < docs[i].size(); j++) {
00583             if (docs[i][j].getDocName() == query) {
00584                 SelfDoc::printExplanation(docs[i][j],cout);
00585                 exit(0);
00586             }
00587         }
00588     }
00589     Err::errAbort("Didn't find any documentation for: '" + ToStr(query) + "'");
00590 }
00591 
00592 
00593 void EngineUtil::getCelFiles(std::vector<std::string> &celFiles, BaseEngine *engine) {
00594     if (engine->getOpt("cel-files")!="") {
00595         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00596 #ifdef WIN32
00597         tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00598 #endif
00599         std::string celFilesFile = engine->getOpt("cel-files");
00600         string file;
00601         tsv.bind(0, "cel_files", &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00602         if (tsv.open(celFilesFile) != TSV_OK) {
00603             Err::errAbort("Couldn't open cel-files file: " + celFilesFile);
00604         }
00605         tsv.rewind();
00606         while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00607             celFiles.push_back(file);
00608         }
00609         tsv.close();
00610         Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(celFiles.size()) + " cel files from: " + Fs::basename(celFilesFile));
00611     } 
00612     else {
00613         celFiles = engine->getOptVector("cels");
00614         if (celFiles.size() == 0) {
00615             for (vector<const char *>::size_type i = 0; i < engine->getArgCount(); i++)
00616                 celFiles.push_back(engine->getArg(i));
00617         }
00618 #ifdef WIN32
00619         // Windows doesn't do wildcard expansion in windows, let the user know.
00620         if (celFiles.size() > 0 && celFiles[0].find("\*") != string::npos) {
00621             Err::errAbort("Wildcard ('*') expansion not available in windows, please use --cel-files option.");
00622         }
00623 #endif
00624     }
00625 }
00626 
00627 void EngineUtil::getChpFiles(std::vector<std::string> &chpFiles, BaseEngine *engine) {
00628     if (engine->getOpt("chp-files")!="") {
00629         affx::TsvFile tsv;
00630 #ifdef WIN32
00631         tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00632 #endif
00633         std::string chpFilesFile = engine->getOpt("chp-files");
00634         string file;
00635         tsv.bind(0, "chp_files", &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00636         if (tsv.open(chpFilesFile) != TSV_OK) {
00637             Err::errAbort("Couldn't open chp-files file: " + chpFilesFile);
00638         }
00639         tsv.rewind();
00640         while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00641             chpFiles.push_back(file);
00642         }
00643         tsv.close();
00644         Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(chpFiles.size()) + " chp files from: " + Fs::basename(chpFilesFile));
00645     } 
00646     else {
00647         chpFiles = engine->getOptVector("chps");
00648         if (chpFiles.size() == 0) {
00649             for (vector<const char *>::size_type i = 0; i < engine->getArgCount(); i++)
00650                 chpFiles.push_back(engine->getArg(i));
00651         }
00652 #ifdef WIN32
00653         // Windows doesn't do wildcard expansion in windows, let the user know.
00654         if (chpFiles.size() > 0 && chpFiles[0].find("\*") != string::npos) {
00655             Err::errAbort("Wildcard ('*') expansion not available in windows, please use --chp-files option.");
00656         }
00657 #endif
00658     }
00659 }
